original_title: General election jitters seen as deterring share investors
original_body_lines: Stock market activities were positive but slightly volatile yesterday as the market witnessed some consolidation due to the recent bull-run. However, investors are concerned about the oncoming general election, market analysts said.

The All Share Price Index went up by 16.9 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 2.6 points. Turnover stood at Rs 2.11 billion with six crossings. Those crossings were reported in Softlogic Finance, which crossed 6 million shares to the tune of Rs 34.8 million; its shares traded at Rs 5.80, Commercial Bank 275,000 shares crossed for Rs 31.6 million; its shares traded at Rs 115, LB Finance 300,000 shares crossed for Rs 22.5 million; its shares traded at Rs 75, Pan Asia Bank 800,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.8 million; its shares sold at Rs 26, Melstacope 200,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.2 million; its shares traded at Rs 101 and Sampath Bank 225,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 20 million and its shares fetched Rs 89.

In the retail market top six companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; JKH Rs 529 million (24.5 million shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 140 million (1.2 million shares traded), Dipped Products Rs 138 million (3.4 million shares traded), Lanka Milk Foods Rs 129 million (3.9 million shares traded), Access Engineering Rs 76,5 million (2.9 million shares traded) and Sampath Bank Rs 57 million (645,000 shares traded).During the day 87.1 million share volumes changed hands in 15119 transactions  It is said that banking and financial sector counters were very active during the day.

However, the manufacturing sector counter led the market due to active participation in JKH stocks.Yesterday, the rupee opened more or less flat at Rs 292.75/90 to the US dollar, dealers said, from Rs 292.80/90 the previous day, while bond yields were steady. A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 was quoted at 11.20/25 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2027 was quoted at 11.55/75 percent. A bond maturing on 15.02.2028 was quoted at 11.80/86 percent.
